title: CommandError when using conditional includes in git config
body:
#### What is the problem?

I have a conditional include in my git configuration, that sets a different e-mail address when $PWD is a specific directory:
```
[includeIf "gitdir:~/some_dir/"]
        path = "some_file"
```
`some_file` just contains a different `[user]` section for the configuration.

As long as I have this in my config I get a `CommandError` for any `datalad` command:
```
$ datalad
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/matrss/.conda/envs/datalad/bin/datalad", line 7, in <module>
    from datalad.cmdline.main import main
  File "/home/matrss/.conda/envs/datalad/lib/python3.9/site-packages/datalad/__init__.py", line 48, in <module>
    cfg = ConfigManager()
  File "/home/matrss/.conda/envs/datalad/lib/python3.9/site-packages/datalad/config.py", line 346, in __init__
    self.reload(force=True)
  File "/home/matrss/.conda/envs/datalad/lib/python3.9/site-packages/datalad/config.py", line 399, in reload
    self._stores[store_id] = self._reload(runargs)
  File "/home/matrss/.conda/envs/datalad/lib/python3.9/site-packages/datalad/config.py", line 427, in _reload
    stdout, stderr = self._run(
  File "/home/matrss/.conda/envs/datalad/lib/python3.9/site-packages/datalad/config.py", line 789, in _run
    out = self._runner.run(self._config_cmd + args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/matrss/.conda/envs/datalad/lib/python3.9/site-packages/datalad/cmd.py", line 408, in run
    raise CommandError(
datalad.support.exceptions.CommandError: CommandError: 'git --git-dir= config -z -l --show-origin' failed with exitcode 128 [err: 'fatal: The empty string is not a valid path']
```

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

Adding a conditional include to the git config like above.

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

0.14.6
